elements.content: The paper presents three interesting entanglement systems, including two polyrotaxane-like and one interpenetrating frameworks, namely, [Co(L1)(bpdc)] (1), [Co(L2)(bpdc)] (2), and [Co(L3)1.5(bpdc)(H2O)]·(L3) (3), constructed from biphenyl-4,4′-dicarboxylate and bis(imidazole) ligands (L1 = 1,6-bis(imidazol-1-yl)-hexane, and rods that are interlaced in a parallel fashion to result in 2D → 2D polyrotaxane-like motifs (L2 = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene and L3 = 1,4-bis(1-imidazolyl)-benzene)). Both compounds 1 and 2 contain loops. Compound 3 represents the first example of a triply interpenetrated 5-connected 4466 topology network.
elements.clean_text: The paper presents three interesting entanglement systems, including two polyrotaxane-like and one interpenetrating frameworks, namely, [Co(L1)(bpdc)] (1), [Co(L2)(bpdc)] (2), and [Co(L3)1.5(bpdc)(H2O)]⋅(L3) (3), constructed from biphenyl-4,4'-dicarboxylate and bis(imidazole) ligands (L1 = 1,6-bis(imidazol-1-yl)-hexane, and rods that are interlaced in a parallel fashion to result in 2D → 2D polyrotaxane-like motifs (L2 = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene and L3 = 1,4-bis(1-imidazolyl)-benzene)). Both compounds 1 and 2 contain loops. Compound 3 represents the first example of a triply interpenetrated 5-connected 4466 topology network.

elements.content: Three interesting entanglement systems, including two polyrotaxane-like and one interpenetrating frameworks, are presented. Both compounds 1 and 2 contain loops and rods that are interlaced in a parallel fashion to result in 2D → 2D polyrotaxane-like motifs. Compound 3 represents the first example of a 3-fold interpenetrated 5-connected three-dimensional framework.
elements.clean_text: Three interesting entanglement systems, including two polyrotaxane-like and one interpenetrating frameworks, are presented. Both compounds 1 and 2 contain loops and rods that are interlaced in a parallel fashion to result in 2D → 2D polyrotaxane-like motifs. Compound 3 represents the first example of a 3-fold interpenetrated 5-connected three-dimensional framework.

elements.content: Metal−organic frameworks (MOFs) exhibiting entangled architectures have attracted considerable interest because of their undisputed beauty and potential applications. There are some comprehensive reviews by Robson, Batten, and Ciani’s groups of many fascinating entangled structures, such as the common catenated arrays (for example, interpenetration) and the more complex rotaxane-like species, viz. polycatenated, polythreaded, and polyknotted species. Conceptually, interpenetrating networks can be described as a number of individual nets participating in interpenetration with each other. So far, a large number of interpenetrating networks have been reported in the literature and by us. In all interpenetrating networks, by definition, rotaxane-like interactions can be defined (and also for all molecular catenanes). However, in true polyrotaxanes, by analogy to molecular rotaxanes, the ring and rod components should not be connected except by the rotaxane mechanical bond, and there should be no catenane-type interactions. In particular, the higher dimensional polyrotaxane-like networks are still quite rare. As far as we know, only a few desirable examples showing the one-dimensional or two dimensional (1D or 2D) polyrotaxane associations hitherto have been characterized. Therefore, the study of this facet is still a challenging issue in coordination chemistry.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

Metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) exhibiting entangled architectures have attracted considerable interest because of their undisputed beauty and potential applications. There are some comprehensive reviews by Robson, Batten, and Ciani's groups of many fascinating entangled structures, such as the common catenated arrays (for example, interpenetration) and the more complex rotaxane-like species, viz. polycatenated, polythreaded, and polyknotted species. Conceptually, interpenetrating networks can be described as a number of individual nets participating in interpenetration with each other. So far, a large number of interpenetrating networks have been reported in the literature and by us. In all interpenetrating networks, by definition, rotaxane-like interactions can be defined (and also for all molecular catenanes). However, in true polyrotaxanes, by analogy to molecular rotaxanes, the ring and rod components should not be connected except by the rotaxane mechanical bond, and there should be no catenane-type interactions. In particular, the higher dimensional polyrotaxane-like networks are still quite rare. As far as we know, only a few desirable examples showing the one-dimensional or two dimensional (1D or 2D) polyrotaxane associations hitherto have been characterized. Therefore, the study of this facet is still a challenging issue in coordination chemistry.

elements.content: Up to now, a large number of mixed-ligand MOFs have been successfully obtained, which suggests that the introduction of N-containing auxiliary ligands into a metal-polycarboxylate system often leads to structural changes and affords new frameworks. In particular, coordination polymers with flexible ligands exhibit more complex structural peculiarity due to the characteristics of flexible ligands. Hence, mixed-ligand is undoubtedly a good choice for the construction of new polymeric structures. According to the basic design element of the polyrotaxane-like framework, our strategy is to select two functionally different ligands. One ligand, usually a conformationally N-donor flexible ligand, serves to assemble a molecular unit with loops, whereas the other ligand, often a long rigid polycarboxylate, forms metal-polycarboxylate substructures (e.g., chains or sheets) and more importantly provides a linear rod to insert those loops. During deep investigations on the use of the flexible bis(imidazole) ligand, 1,6-bis(imidazol-1-yl)-hexane (L1) and 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene (L2)(Scheme ), together with different bivalent metal salts, we find these spacers prefer to achieve a M2L2 metallocyclic ring when adopting a cis conformation. Moreover, biphenyl-4,4′-dicarboxylic acid (H2bpdc) is a good candidate for acting as a rod in the assembly, attributed to its appropriate molecular length and rigidity. On the other hand, the rigid 1,4-bis(1-imidazolyl)-benzene (L3) ligand has already proven a certain ability to give interpenetrating networks in our previous works. Inspired by those ideas, we successfully obtained three entangled frameworks, namely, [Co(L1)(bpdc)] (1), [Co(L2)(bpdc)] (2), and [Co(L3)1.5(bpdc)(H2O)]·(L3) (3). All compounds are characterized by elemental analysis and X-ray crystallography. The crystal structures as well as topological analysis of these compounds will be represented and discussed in detail. In addition, their thermal properties are studied by thermogravimetric analysis (TGA).
elements.clean_text: Up to now, a large number of mixed-ligand MOFs have been successfully obtained, which suggests that the introduction of N-containing auxiliary ligands into a metal-polycarboxylate system often leads to structural changes and affords new frameworks. In particular, coordination polymers with flexible ligands exhibit more complex structural peculiarity due to the characteristics of flexible ligands. Hence, mixed-ligand is undoubtedly a good choice for the construction of new polymeric structures. According to the basic design element of the polyrotaxane-like framework, our strategy is to select two functionally different ligands. One ligand, usually a conformationally N-donor flexible ligand, serves to assemble a molecular unit with loops, whereas the other ligand, often a long rigid polycarboxylate, forms metal-polycarboxylate substructures (e.g., chains or sheets) and more importantly provides a linear rod to insert those loops. During deep investigations on the use of the flexible bis(imidazole) ligand, 1,6-bis(imidazol-1-yl)-hexane (L1) and 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene (L2)(Scheme ), together with different bivalent metal salts, we find these spacers prefer to achieve a M2L2 metallocyclic ring when adopting a cis conformation. Moreover, biphenyl-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid (H2bpdc) is a good candidate for acting as a rod in the assembly, attributed to its appropriate molecular length and rigidity. On the other hand, the rigid 1,4-bis(1-imidazolyl)-benzene (L3) ligand has already proven a certain ability to give interpenetrating networks in our previous works. Inspired by those ideas, we successfully obtained three entangled frameworks, namely, [Co(L1)(bpdc)] (1), [Co(L2)(bpdc)] (2), and [Co(L3)1.5(bpdc)(H2O)]⋅(L3) (3). All compounds are characterized by elemental analysis and X-ray crystallography. The crystal structures as well as topological analysis of these compounds will be represented and discussed in detail. In addition, their thermal properties are studied by thermogravimetric analysis (TGA).

<label>1</label>
<graphic id="gr1" orientation="portrait" position="anchor" xlink:href="cg-2009-006372_0005.tif"></graphic>
</fig>

Solvents and starting materials for synthesis were purchased commercially and used as received. The ligands L1−L3 were prepared according to reported procedures. Elemental analysis for C, H, and N was performed on a Perkin-Elmer 240 analyzer. The thermogravimetric analysis was performed with a Shimadzu TGA-50H TG analyzer in the range of 25−700 °C under a nitrogen flow at a heating rate of 5 °C/min for all measurements.
elements.clean_text:
Experimental Section

Materials and General Procedures

Solvents and starting materials for synthesis were purchased commercially and used as received. The ligands L1-L3 were prepared according to reported procedures. Elemental analysis for C, H, and N was performed on a Perkin-Elmer 240 analyzer. The thermogravimetric analysis was performed with a Shimadzu TGA-50H TG analyzer in the range of 25-700 °C under a nitrogen flow at a heating rate of 5 °C/min for all measurements.

elements.content: Suitable single crystals of 1−3 were selected and mounted in air onto thin glass fibers. Accurate unit cell parameters were determined by a least-squares fit of 2θ values, and intensity data were measured on a Rigaku r-axis rapid IP area detector with Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å) at room temperature. The intensities were corrected for Lorentz and polarization effects as well as for empirical absorption based on multiscan techniques; all structures were solved by direct methods and refined by full-matrix least-squares fitting on F 2 by SHELX-97. All non-hydrogen atoms were refined with anisotropic thermal parameters. Crystallographic data for compounds 1−3 are summarized in Table and selected bond lengths and bond angles for compounds 1−3 are listed in .
elements.clean_text:
X-ray Crystallographic Measurements for 1-3 

Suitable single crystals of 1-3 were selected and mounted in air onto thin glass fibers. Accurate unit cell parameters were determined by a least-squares fit of 2θ values, and intensity data were measured on a Rigaku r-axis rapid IP area detector with Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å) at room temperature. The intensities were corrected for Lorentz and polarization effects as well as for empirical absorption based on multiscan techniques; all structures were solved by direct methods and refined by full-matrix least-squares fitting on F 2 by SHELX-97. All non-hydrogen atoms were refined with anisotropic thermal parameters. Crystallographic data for compounds 1-3 are summarized in Table  and selected bond lengths and bond angles for compounds 1-3 are listed in .

elements.content: The mixture of CoCl2·6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H2bpdc (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), and L1 (0.22 g, 1.0 mmol) was dissolved in 6 mL of distilled water and 1 mL of DMF. The pH was adjusted to 6.0 by addition of 1 M NaOH solution. Consequently, the resulting mixture was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was sealed and heated at 180 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Purple crystals were obtained and in yield: 55% (based on Co). Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. For 1: C 60.35, H 5.06, N 10.83; Found: C 60.38, H 5.11, N 10.80.
elements.clean_text:
Synthesis of [Co(L1)(bpdc)] (1)

The mixture of CoCl2⋅6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H2bpdc (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), and L1 (0.22 g, 1.0 mmol) was dissolved in 6 mL of distilled water and 1 mL of DMF. The pH was adjusted to 6.0 by addition of 1 M NaOH solution. Consequently, the resulting mixture was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was sealed and heated at 180 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Purple crystals were obtained and in yield: 55% (based on Co). Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. For 1: C 60.35, H 5.06, N 10.83; Found: C 60.38, H 5.11, N 10.80.

elements.content: The mixture of CoCl2·6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H2bpdc (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), and L2 (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol) was dissolved 6 mL of distilled water and 1 mL of DMF. The pH was adjusted to 6.0 by addition of 1 M NaOH solution. Consequently, the resulting mixture was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was sealed and heated at 180 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Blue crystals were obtained and in yield: 41% (based on Co). Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. For 2: C 62.58, H 4.13, N 10.42; Found: C 62.51, H 4.15, N 10.45.
elements.clean_text:
Synthesis of [Co(L2)(bpdc)] (2)

The mixture of CoCl2⋅6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H2bpdc (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), and L2 (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol) was dissolved 6 mL of distilled water and 1 mL of DMF. The pH was adjusted to 6.0 by addition of 1 M NaOH solution. Consequently, the resulting mixture was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was sealed and heated at 180 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Blue crystals were obtained and in yield: 41% (based on Co). Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. For 2: C 62.58, H 4.13, N 10.42; Found: C 62.51, H 4.15, N 10.45.

elements.content: CoCl2·6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H2bpdc (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), and L3 (0.21 g, 1.0 mmol) was dissolved in 6 mL of distilled water and 1 mL of DMF. The pH was adjusted to 6.0 by addition of 1 M NaOH solution. Consequently, the resulting mixture was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was sealed and heated at 180 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Green crystals were obtained and in yield: 58% (based on Co). Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. For 3: C 62.71, H 4.19, N 16.62; Found: C 62.69, H 4.23, N 16.67.
elements.clean_text:
Synthesis of [Co(L3)1.5(bpdc)(H2O)]⋅(L3) (3)

CoCl2⋅6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H2bpdc (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), and L3 (0.21 g, 1.0 mmol) was dissolved in 6 mL of distilled water and 1 mL of DMF. The pH was adjusted to 6.0 by addition of 1 M NaOH solution. Consequently, the resulting mixture was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was sealed and heated at 180 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Green crystals were obtained and in yield: 58% (based on Co). Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. For 3: C 62.71, H 4.19, N 16.62; Found: C 62.69, H 4.23, N 16.67.

Single crystal X-ray analysis reveals that compounds 1 and 2 are isostructural. Both compounds are self-assembled from the flexible bis(imidazole) ligands (L1 or L2) as annular linker motifs and bpdc2− anion as linking rods, that are further interlaced in a parallel fashion to give a 2D → 2D polyrotaxane-like network. Hence, only the crystal structure of compound 1 was described in detail. The asymmetric unit of 1 consists of one independent Co(II) ion, one independent L1 molecule, and one independent bpdc2− anion. As shown in Figure a, each Co(II) ion in 1 is four-coordinate with distorted tetrahedral geometry, composed of two carboxylic O atoms from two bpdc2− anions (Co−O = 1.974(3) Å and1.981(3) Å) and two N atoms from two L1 ligands (Co−N = 2.010(3) and 2.032(3) Å). All the L1 ligands adopt cis conformation with the dihedral angle between the two imidazolyl rings of 64.28°. Two L1 ligands connect two Co(II) atoms to achieve a 26-membered [Co2(bimh2)] metallocyclic ring exhibiting maximum dimensions of (corresponding to the Co···Co distance and shortest intracycle C···C separation) 12.473 Å × 8.539 Å. Each completely deprotonated bpdc2− anion coordinates to two Co atoms in the monodentate mode.
elements.clean_text:
Results and Discussion

Crystal Structure of [Co(L1)(bpdc)] (1)

Single crystal X-ray analysis reveals that compounds 1 and 2 are isostructural. Both compounds are self-assembled from the flexible bis(imidazole) ligands (L1 or L2) as annular linker motifs and bpdc2- anion as linking rods, that are further interlaced in a parallel fashion to give a 2D → 2D polyrotaxane-like network. Hence, only the crystal structure of compound 1 was described in detail. The asymmetric unit of 1 consists of one independent Co(II) ion, one independent L1 molecule, and one independent bpdc2- anion. As shown in Figure a, each Co(II) ion in 1 is four-coordinate with distorted tetrahedral geometry, composed of two carboxylic O atoms from two bpdc2- anions (Co-O = 1.974(3) Å and1.981(3) Å) and two N atoms from two L1 ligands (Co-N = 2.010(3) and 2.032(3) Å). All the L1 ligands adopt cis conformation with the dihedral angle between the two imidazolyl rings of 64.28°. Two L1 ligands connect two Co(II) atoms to achieve a 26-membered [Co2(bimh2)] metallocyclic ring exhibiting maximum dimensions of (corresponding to the Co⋅⋅⋅Co distance and shortest intracycle C⋅⋅⋅C separation) 12.473 Å × 8.539 Å. Each completely deprotonated bpdc2- anion coordinates to two Co atoms in the monodentate mode.

elements.content: The extension of the structure into a 2D sheet is accomplished by linear bpdc2− anions linking the [Co2(bimh2)] loops, as shown in Figure b. That is to say, each Co atom is connected to three others: two via single bpdc2− bridges and a third by pairs of L1 ligands. In this analysis, the network topology features a 3-connected net with (6,3). Furthermore, the 2D layer is one more example for which a special notation is needed to describe the topology: the introduction of 2-connected nodes in the point/schlafli symbol. Such notation is the 2-membered rings (i.e., the “loops”), introduced by Ma and Batten. Therefore, the whole net is a 4-connected (2·65) network.
elements.clean_text: The extension of the structure into a 2D sheet is accomplished by linear bpdc2- anions linking the [Co2(bimh2)] loops, as shown in Figure b. That is to say, each Co atom is connected to three others: two via single bpdc2- bridges and a third by pairs of L1 ligands. In this analysis, the network topology features a 3-connected net with (6,3). Furthermore, the 2D layer is one more example for which a special notation is needed to describe the topology: the introduction of 2-connected nodes in the point/schlafli symbol. Such notation is the 2-membered rings (i.e., the "loops"), introduced by Ma and Batten. Therefore, the whole net is a 4-connected (2⋅65) network.

elements.content: Of particular interest, the most striking feature of complex 1 is that a pair of identical 2D single nets is interlocked with each other in a 2D → 2D parallel fashion thus directly leading to the formation of a 2D polyrotaxane-like structure containing rotaxane-like motifs (Figure c). As shown in Figure c, the Co2L1 2 loops of each net are threaded by one Co-bpdc-Co rods of the other net, and vice versa. Polyrotaxane system, regarded as the extended periodic version of molecular rotaxane motifs, features closed loops and rods or string elements that can thread through the loops, in which the different motifs cannot be disentangled without breaking links. The type of polythreading involving 2D components hitherto is relatively rare according to the literature. Only three examples showing a similar 2D → 2D polythreaded array as that of 1 and 2 are the compounds [Zn(bix)2(NO3)2]·4.5H2O (bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene)) (I), [Co2(1,3-bix)2(bpea)2] (1,3-bix = 1,3-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, H2bpea = biphenylethene-4,4′-dicarboxylic acid) (II), and [Cd(μ-tp)(μ-bpp)(H2O)] n ·nH2O (H2tp = terephthalic acid, bpp = 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)propane)) (III). In compound I, both the ring and rod elements consist of the flexible bix ligands, while in compounds II and III, the flexible N-donor ligands act as an annular linker motif and aromatic dicarboxylate anion act as linking rods, respectively.
elements.clean_text: Of particular interest, the most striking feature of complex 1 is that a pair of identical 2D single nets is interlocked with each other in a 2D → 2D parallel fashion thus directly leading to the formation of a 2D polyrotaxane-like structure containing rotaxane-like motifs (Figure c). As shown in Figure c, the Co2L1 2 loops of each net are threaded by one Co-bpdc-Co rods of the other net, and vice versa. Polyrotaxane system, regarded as the extended periodic version of molecular rotaxane motifs, features closed loops and rods or string elements that can thread through the loops, in which the different motifs cannot be disentangled without breaking links. The type of polythreading involving 2D components hitherto is relatively rare according to the literature. Only three examples showing a similar 2D → 2D polythreaded array as that of 1 and 2 are the compounds [Zn(bix)2(NO3)2]⋅4.5H2O (bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene)) (I), [Co2(1,3-bix)2(bpea)2] (1,3-bix = 1,3-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, H2bpea = biphenylethene-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid) (II), and [Cd(μ-tp)(μ-bpp)(H2O)] n ⋅nH2O (H2tp = terephthalic acid, bpp = 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)propane)) (III). In compound I, both the ring and rod elements consist of the flexible bix ligands, while in compounds II and III, the flexible N-donor ligands act as an annular linker motif and aromatic dicarboxylate anion act as linking rods, respectively.

elements.content: (a) The immediate coordination environment around the Co(II) center in 1. (b) A view of a single sheet in 1. (c) A view of the two interpenetrating nets in 1.
elements.clean_text: 1  (a) The immediate coordination environment around the Co(II) center in 1. (b) A view of a single sheet in 1. (c) A view of the two interpenetrating nets in 1.

elements.content: Polymer 3 crystallizes in triclinic space group of P1̅. The asymmetric unit of 3 consists of one independent Co(II) ion, one and a half independent L3 molecule, one independent bpdc2− anion, one independent coordinated water molecule, and one independent free L3 ligand. Each Co(II) ions in 3 exhibits a distorted octahedral environment, composed of two carboxylic O atoms from three bpdc2− anions (Co−O = 2.093(3) Å and 2.123(3) Å), three N atoms from three L3 ligands (Co−N = 2.122(4)−2.143(4) Å) and one water molecule (Co−O = 2.149(4) Å), as shown in Figure a. The Co−O/N distances fall in the normal range found in other Co complexes.
elements.clean_text:
Crystal Structure of [Co(L3)1.5(bpdc)(H2O)]⋅(L3) (3)

Polymer 3 crystallizes in triclinic space group of P1̅. The asymmetric unit of 3 consists of one independent Co(II) ion, one and a half independent L3 molecule, one independent bpdc2- anion, one independent coordinated water molecule, and one independent free L3 ligand. Each Co(II) ions in 3 exhibits a distorted octahedral environment, composed of two carboxylic O atoms from three bpdc2- anions (Co-O = 2.093(3) Å and 2.123(3) Å), three N atoms from three L3 ligands (Co-N = 2.122(4)-2.143(4) Å) and one water molecule (Co-O = 2.149(4) Å), as shown in Figure a. The Co-O/N distances fall in the normal range found in other Co complexes.

elements.content: Each octahedral Co atom coordinates to three L3 ligands to form a 2D brick wall network with a (6, 3) topology (Figure b). The completely deprotonated bpdc2− anions link two Co atoms belonging to two adjacent sheets through the carboxylate coordination. The resulting array is a 5-connected 3D network with a 4466 topology containing large cages (Figure c). Although the free L3 molecules occupy some void space, the potential voids are large enough to be filled via mutual interpenetration of two independent equivalent frameworks, generating a 3-fold interpenetrating three-dimensional architecture (Figure d). Compared to the architectures based on metal centers with 2-, 3-, 4-, or 6-connectivity, metal−organic materials based upon 5-connected nodes are much rarer, and only a few examples of frameworks with 3D 5-connected networks have been reported to date, including 2-fold interpenetrated networks, self-penetrated fameworks, and noninterpenetration motifs. Thus, compound 3 is the first example of 3-fold interpenetrating 5-connected net.
elements.clean_text: Each octahedral Co atom coordinates to three L3 ligands to form a 2D brick wall network with a (6, 3) topology (Figure b). The completely deprotonated bpdc2- anions link two Co atoms belonging to two adjacent sheets through the carboxylate coordination. The resulting array is a 5-connected 3D network with a 4466 topology containing large cages (Figure c). Although the free L3 molecules occupy some void space, the potential voids are large enough to be filled via mutual interpenetration of two independent equivalent frameworks, generating a 3-fold interpenetrating three-dimensional architecture (Figure d). Compared to the architectures based on metal centers with 2-, 3-, 4-, or 6-connectivity, metal-organic materials based upon 5-connected nodes are much rarer, and only a few examples of frameworks with 3D 5-connected networks have been reported to date, including 2-fold interpenetrated networks, self-penetrated fameworks, and noninterpenetration motifs. Thus, compound 3 is the first example of 3-fold interpenetrating 5-connected net.

elements.content: (a) The immediate coordination environment around the Co(II) center in 3. (b) 2D brick wall (6, 3) net constructed from Co(II) centers and L3 ligands. (c) Schematic representation of a single 3D framework of 3. (d) Schematic representation of 3-fold interpenetrating 3D 5-connected net of 3.
elements.clean_text: 2  (a) The immediate coordination environment around the Co(II) center in 3. (b) 2D brick wall (6, 3) net constructed from Co(II) centers and L3 ligands. (c) Schematic representation of a single 3D framework of 3. (d) Schematic representation of 3-fold interpenetrating 3D 5-connected net of 3.

elements.content: To estimate the stability of the coordination architectures, thermogravimetric analyses experiments were carried out. As shown in Figure , the frameworks of polymers 1, 2, and 3 are stable up to about 383, 400, and 275 °C, respectively. At about 470 °C, 1 decomposed completely and the remaining residues are CoO (calcd. 14.48%, exp. 15.21%), while 2 did not decompose completely until 700 °C. Polymer 3 releases the free L3 ligand at 190−370 °C (calc. 24.9%, exp. 24.5%) and lost the coordinated water molecules at 140−200 °C (calc. 2.14%, exp. 2.05%), respectively.
elements.clean_text:
Thermal Analyses

To estimate the stability of the coordination architectures, thermogravimetric analyses experiments were carried out. As shown in Figure , the frameworks of polymers 1, 2, and 3 are stable up to about 383, 400, and 275 °C, respectively. At about 470 °C, 1 decomposed completely and the remaining residues are CoO (calcd. 14.48%, exp. 15.21%), while 2 did not decompose completely until 700 °C. Polymer 3 releases the free L3 ligand at 190-370 °C (calc. 24.9%, exp. 24.5%) and lost the coordinated water molecules at 140-200 °C (calc. 2.14%, exp. 2.05%), respectively.

elements.content: TG plots of these MOFs.
elements.clean_text: 3  TG plots of these MOFs.

elements.content: In conclusion, we have successfully synthesized and characterized three entanglement systems, including two polyrotaxane-like and one interpenetrating frameworks, based on the nature of the flexible and the rigid bis(imidazole) ligands. The flexible nature of spacer allows the ligands to bend and rotate when it coordinates to metal centers. In particular, they favor forming a 2-membered metallcycle when adopting cis conformation. While the rigid bis(imidazole) ligand tends to construct the coordination polymers exhibiting high porosity, the potential void allows a number of individual nets participating in interpenetration with each other. It is believed that more metal complexes containing such bis(imidazole) ligands and aromatic polycarboxylate anions with interesting structures as well as physical properties will be synthesized in the future.
elements.clean_text:
Conclusions

In conclusion, we have successfully synthesized and characterized three entanglement systems, including two polyrotaxane-like and one interpenetrating frameworks, based on the nature of the flexible and the rigid bis(imidazole) ligands. The flexible nature of spacer allows the ligands to bend and rotate when it coordinates to metal centers. In particular, they favor forming a 2-membered metallcycle when adopting cis conformation. While the rigid bis(imidazole) ligand tends to construct the coordination polymers exhibiting high porosity, the potential void allows a number of individual nets participating in interpenetration with each other. It is believed that more metal complexes containing such bis(imidazole) ligands and aromatic polycarboxylate anions with interesting structures as well as physical properties will be synthesized in the future.

elements.clean_text: X-ray crystallographic file in CIF format, tables of bond lengths and angles for all the compounds (Table S1), and all figures of 2 (Figure S1) are available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

cln_elements.content:
The mixture of CoCl2·6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H2bpdc (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), and L1 (0.22 g, 1.0 mmol) was dissolved in 6 mL of distilled water and 1 mL of DMF. The pH was adjusted to 6.0 by addition of 1 M NaOH solution. Consequently, the resulting mixture was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was sealed and heated at 180 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Purple crystals were obtained and in yield: 55% (based on Co). Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. For 1: C 60.35, H 5.06, N 10.83; Found: C 60.38, H 5.11, N 10.80.

Synthesis of [Co(L<sup>2</sup>)(bpdc)] (<bold>2</bold>)

The mixture of CoCl2·6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H2bpdc (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), and L2 (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol) was dissolved 6 mL of distilled water and 1 mL of DMF. The pH was adjusted to 6.0 by addition of 1 M NaOH solution. Consequently, the resulting mixture was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was sealed and heated at 180 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Blue crystals were obtained and in yield: 41% (based on Co). Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. For 2: C 62.58, H 4.13, N 10.42; Found: C 62.51, H 4.15, N 10.45.

Synthesis of [Co(L<sup>3</sup>)<sub>1.5</sub>(bpdc)(H<sub>2</sub>O)]·(L<sup>3</sup>) (<bold>3</bold>)

CoCl2·6H2O (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), H2bpdc (0.24 g, 1.0 mmol), and L3 (0.21 g, 1.0 mmol) was dissolved in 6 mL of distilled water and 1 mL of DMF. The pH was adjusted to 6.0 by addition of 1 M NaOH solution. Consequently, the resulting mixture was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was sealed and heated at 180 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Green crystals were obtained and in yield: 58% (based on Co). Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. For 3: C 62.71, H 4.19, N 16.62; Found: C 62.69, H 4.23, N 16.67.

Consequently, the resulting mixture was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was sealed and heated at 180 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Purple crystals were obtained and in yield: 55% (based on Co). Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. For 1: C 60.35, H 5.06, N 10.83; Found: C 60.38, H 5.11, N 10.80.

Consequently, the resulting mixture was transferred and sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel, which was sealed and heated at 180 °C for 3 days, and then the reaction system was cooled to room temperature. Blue crystals were obtained and in yield: 41% (based on Co). Elemental analysis (%): Calcd. For 2: C 62.58, H 4.13, N 10.42; Found: C 62.51, H 4.15, N 10.45.

Synthesis of [Co(L3)1.5(bpdc)(H2O)]⋅(L3) (3)

metadata.title: Polyrotaxane-like and Interpenetrating Metal−Organic Frameworks (MOFs) Constructed from Biphenyl-4,4′-Dicarboxylate and Bis(imidazole) Ligand
